page.title: 14COMMUNITY ORGANISATIONS (1)
page.content: Being urban, the area is well served by community organisations. The L.E.A. policy is to change schools to dual purpose buildings (school by day & community centre in the evenings) but there are also a number of purpose built community centres in the area which can be used throughout the day as well as church halls. The Braunstone Community Centre is used for playgroups, senior citizen meetings, a youth club, 'Pop mobility' and indoor sports. The Southfields Drive Community Centre has a similar prospectus and serves the Saffron Lane Estate. The Rowley Fields School and Community Centre has many evening meetings (including Adult Education) and runs a summer playscheme. Although the other large schools in the area are not Community Centres they do provide Adult Education facilities.
